TopicTitle: Recommended mods for exploring the solar system?

Articles.Content:
Sorry, my english is not too good.

Hey, I crashed on KSP when a patch voided months of work. Trying to get back into the game again since its been a year+ since I played it. I tried to use that replacement for Kerbal Space Port on Curse site but it seems like a lot of the mods are outdated, or generally broken and Curse's layout seems unfriendly.

Was hoping for a few recommended mods for simply giving more reason for exploring the solar system, more ways to science, and generally giving more purpose to visiting the existing planets besides getting science, taking off and leaving to never return. Maybe for example colonization, or the ability to mine to refuel vessels from said planets.

I dunno what exactly. I'll be honest when I say I liked science career mode much more then the full career mode.

You might try RoverDudes mods he has a whole list of goodies [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/79588-0-90-USI-Kolonization-Systems-%28MKS-OKS%29-%280-22-8%29-2015-02-27](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/79588-0-90-USI-Kolonization-Systems-%28MKS-OKS%29-%280-22-8%29-2015-02-27)

Thank you for recommandations! They look very interesting, and I will give it a try. Is Kethane still a mod? I find complaint it is outdated.

Is it generally better to look at this site for mods? I tried Curse because I used to Kerbal Space Port and was redirected. It seems odd that site list outdated mods.

RoverDude's stuff isn't that great for planetary exploration, more of settlement. Karbonite is the replacement for Kethane, and Karbonite is made by RoverDude, so not all of his stuff is for settlement. He also has a warp drive mod that is not overpowered.

I always browse for mods on this forum.

For science there is the StationScience, which again isn't much of exploration, but still very fun. There's DMagic Orbital Sciences for more science experiments.

To help get to the various planets and moons, there is the NearFuture packs which add some nice tech, including advanced electrical propulsion systems and nuclear reactors.
